required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Pharmacokinetics Study of ODM-201 in Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Pharmacokinetics of ODM-201 in Patients With Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer: Open, Non-randomised, Uncontrolled, Multicentre, Multiple Dose Escalation Study With a Randomised Phase II Expansion Component

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of ODM-201 in patients with castrate resistant prostate cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: Number of Participants Who Experienced Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days for each cohort
primary_outcome.description: A DLT was any Grade 3 or more toxicity (by National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [NCI CTCAE version 4.03]) excluding less than Grade 4 neutropenia or thrombocytopenia, hematological toxicity lasting less than 7 days, and nausea, vomiting, diarrhea controlled with antiemetic and/or anti-diarrheal treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: Number of Dose Limiting Toxicities Used to Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days for each cohort
primary_outcome.description: The MTD is defined as dose level at which 2 or more out of 6 participants experience a dose limiting toxicity (DLT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With Decline of at Least 50% in Prostate-specific Antigen (PSA) in Chemotherapy-naïve and CYP17i-naïve Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with greater than or equal to 50% decrease in serum PSA from baseline at 12 weeks in group of participants who were naïve to both chemotherapy and CYP17 inhibitor

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With Decline of at Least 50% in Prostate-specific Antigen (PSA) in Post-chemotherapy and CYP17i-naïve Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with greater than or equal to 50% decrease in serum PSA from baseline at 12 weeks in group of participants previously treated with chemotherapy but not CYP17 inhibitor

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With Decline of at Least 50% in Prostate-specific Antigen (PSA) in Post-CYP17i Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with greater than or equal to 50% decrease in serum PSA from baseline at 12 weeks in group of participants previously treated with CYP17 inhibitor

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With RECIST Response in Soft Tissue in Chemotherapy-naïve and CYP17i-naïve Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with overall complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable (SD) soft tissue disease according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1) in chest, abdomen, and pelvic CT or MRI scans.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With RECIST Response in Soft Tissue in Post-chemotherapy and CYP17i-naive Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with overall complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable (SD) soft tissue disease according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1) in chest, abdomen, and pelvic CT or MRI scans.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With RECIST Responses in Soft Tissue in Post-CYP17i Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with overall complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable (SD) soft tissue disease according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1) in chest, abdomen, and pelvic CT or MRI scans.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With Stable Bone Disease in Chemotherapy-naïve and CYP17i-naïve Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with stable bone disease (no change). Radiographic bone progression was defined by the appearance of two or more new lesions on bone scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With Stable Bone Disease in Post-chemotherapy and CYP17i-naïve Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with stable bone disease (no change). Radiographic bone progression was defined by the appearance of two or more new lesions on bone scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 and 2: Participants With Stable Bone Disease in Post-CYP17i Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with stable bone disease (no change). Radiographic bone progression was defined by the appearance of two or more new lesions on bone scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: Area Under the Plasma-Concentration-time Curve (AUCt) of ODM-201 at Steady-state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 8 predose 0 h and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6 and 8 h postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of ODM-201 at Steady-state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 8 predose 0 h and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6 and 8 h postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: Time to Reach the Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of ODM-201 at Day 1
Phase 1: Area Under the Plasma-Concentration-time Curve (AUCt) of Major Metabolite ORM-15341 at Steady-state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 8 predose 0 h and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6 and 8 h postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Major Metabolite ORM-15341 at Steady-state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 8 predose 0 h and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6 and 8 h postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: Time to Reach the Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of Major Metabolite ORM-15341 at Day 1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent
- Histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of prostate
- Ongoing androgen deprivation therapy with a LHRH analogue or antagonist or bilateral orchiectomy
- Progressive metastatic disease
- Adequate bone marrow, hepatic, and renal function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known metastases in the brain
- History of other malignancy within the previous 5 years
- Known gastrointestinal disease or procedure that affects the absorption
- Not able to swallow the study drug

overall_official.affiliation: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

facility.name: Eastern CT Hematology and Oncology Associates
Klinika onkologie a radioterapie LFUK a FN
Oddeleni Radiacni a Klinicke Onkologie Nemocnice Znojmo

link.description: Lancet Oncology publication containing study results
PubMed link to the Lancet Oncology publication containing study results

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at 23 hospitals in Europe and in the USA from Apr 5, 2011 to Mar 12, 2013
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 136 participants participated in the study, including 24 enrolled in Phase 1 and 112 in Phase 2 randomly assigned to 200 mg, 400 mg or 1400 mg daily doses and stratified by previous chemotherapy and treatment with CYP17 inhibitor. Two participants assigned to treatment did not start ODM-201, and were therefore excluded from analyses populations.

group.description: Chemotherapy-naïve and CYP17 inhibitor-naïve, Post-chemotherapy and CYP17 inhibitor-naïve, Post-CYP17 inhibitor

outcome.title: Phase 1: Number of Participants Who Experienced Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT)
outcome.description: A DLT was any Grade 3 or more toxicity (by National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [NCI CTCAE version 4.03]) excluding less than Grade 4 neutropenia or thrombocytopenia, hematological toxicity lasting less than 7 days, and nausea, vomiting, diarrhea controlled with antiemetic and/or anti-diarrheal treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days for each cohort
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants in Phase 1 who received any study drug.

group.description: Participants received twice daily of oral ODM-201 continuously.
